intro: Codonopsis subglobosa, commonly known as the globe bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its spherical, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and thrives in well-drained soils. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional Chinese medicine. The leaves are lance-shaped and the plant produces small, elongated fruits that contain seeds.
